Basic.name: spr
Basic.description: Sets the image file for the terrain square.

Basic.name: gold
Basic.description: Gold income for the terrain when owned.

Basic.name: iron
Basic.description: Iron income for the terrain when owned.

Basic.name: trade
Basic.description: Trade value of the terrain when owned.

Basic.name: herbs
Basic.description: Herb income for the terrain when owned.

Basic.name: fungus
Basic.description: Fungus income for the terrain when owned.

Basic.name: weed
Basic.description: Weed income for the terrain when owned.

Basic.name: sacr
Basic.description: Sacrifice income for the terrain when owned.

Basic.name: dead
Basic.description: The location starts with <nbr> * d6 corpses in it.

Basic.name: hands
Basic.description: Hands of Glory income for the terrain when owned.

Basic.name: gems
Basic.description: A bitmask value that determines the gem income of the location. See the Gem Income Bitmask table. Note that you can add multiple 1 income values together to create a higher income value of a certain type of gem. Maximum income for a single gem type is 7.

Basic.name: pop
Basic.description: A value indicating the size of humanlike population. Farm = 5 City = 50.

Basic.name: lifeforce
Basic.description: Sets amount of lifeforce that can be drained from the square * 10. A plain has 10 and a forest 30. Negative values means square drain lifeforce with this radius (Pillar of Power has a value of -1).

Basic.name: apcost
Basic.description: Action Point cost for moving through the terrain.

Copy/Clear.name: clearspec
Copy/Clear.description: Clears the special attributes of the selected terrain.

Copy/Clear.name: clearfort
Copy/Clear.description: Clears the fort attributes of the selected terrain.

Special.name: citadel
Special.description: The terrain functions as a citadel when owned.

Special.name: batmap
Special.description: Associates the terrain with a certain battle map. See table Battle Maps. This is usually used for fortified locations but villages also have a battle map.

Special.name: walls
Special.description: The location has walls in battle and is a siegable location.

Special.name: woodengate
Special.description: The fort has a wooden gate

Special.name: irongate
Special.description: The fort has an iron gate

Special.name: enchantedgate
Special.description: The fort has an enchanted gate

Special.name: bramblegate
Special.description: Bramble gate

Special.name: barricade
Special.description: Wooden barricade gate

Special.name: earthbarricade
Special.description: Earth barricade gate

Special.name: cloudgate
Special.description: Cloud gate

Special.name: magicwalls
Special.description: Ethereal units cannot pass through walls at this fort

Special.name: burnable
Special.description: The terran can be burned like forest.

Special.name: water
Special.description: The terrain is water and cannot be passed unless it is frozen or the monsters moving through it are amphibian or aquatic.

Special.name: cave
Special.description: The terrain counts as a cave.

Special.name: nostdrec
Special.description: Standard class based recruitment lists are not available in this terrain. Instead there are other units available for recruitment specific to the terrain.

Special.name: ownable
Special.description: The terrain can be claimed for ownership if it provides income the player can use.

Special.name: smoke
Special.description: Pixels with a certain pink color (2450255) will produce smoke. Pixels with color (2350255) will produce flames and smoke.

Special.name: goldboost
Special.description: The terrain provides a global boost to gold income when owned.

Special.name: ironboost
Special.description: The terrain provides a global boost to iron incomewhen owned.

Special.name: tradeboost
Special.description: The terrain provides a global boost to trade points when owned.

Special.name: harvest
Special.description: Structures with this command get double gold income during bumper harvest events. Farms have this attribute.

Special.name: invisible
Special.description: Terrain on top of the background (like the tower) is not drawn but the grass will still be drawn. Not a useful command for modding.

Special.name: forest
Special.description: The terrain counts as forest for the purposes of abilities like Forest Stealth.

Special.name: mountain
Special.description: The terrain counts as a mountain for the purposes of abilities like Mountain Move.

Special.name: desert
Special.description: The terrain counts as a desert for the purposes of abilities like Desert Move.

Special.name: deepspawn
Special.description: Hybrid fishermen can appear here.

Special.name: melts
Special.description: A hint to the AI that the terrain melts after the winter. Frozen lakes and rivers have this attribute. Not a useful command for modding.

Special.name: nostart
Special.description: Players cannot start in this type of terrain. Other squares can be overwritten by a start citadel from a player.

Special.name: woodencitadel
Special.description: Can be used as citadel by the Senator

Special.name: forestcitadel
Special.description: Can be used as citadel by the Troll King.

Special.name: useable
Special.description: There is a special power inherent to the terrain that can be activated by commander actions.

Special.name: rare
Special.description: The terrain is a rare special terrain. It is sometimes deployed at a random place in Elysium by the random map generator.

Special.name: unqiue
Special.description: This terrain is unique and can only be placed once by the random map generator.

Special.name: mine
Special.description: The terrain counts as a mine.

Special.name: farsight
Special.description: The terrain gives increased vision range when there are units present there. Watchtowers and some citadels have this attribute.

Special.name: nosight
Special.description: The terrain does not provide vision into adjacent squares when owned. Forests and swamps have this attribute.

Special.name: temple
Special.description: The terrain counts as a temple.

Special.name: el
Special.description: Terrain starts as converted to the worship of El.

Special.name: settlement
Special.description: Defines the terrain as a human settlement. Hamlets villages towns etc have this attribute.

Special.name: voidret
Special.description: The terrain is connected to the Void. Use for Pyramids and other such structures.

Special.name: library1
Special.description: Library level +1.

Special.name: library2
Special.description: Library level +2.

Special.name: hoburg
Special.description: All starting corpses here will be small size.

Special.name: snowok
Special.description: The terrain can appear in the northern portion of the map and can be snowy.

Special.name: desertok
Special.description: The terrain can appear in the southern portion of the map.

Special.name: invseason
Special.description: Seasons are reversed in this terrain.

Special.name: spreadcold
Special.description: The terrain square spreads cold around it turning nearby squares snowy.

Special.name: tempimmune
Special.description: The terrain will not be transformed into a wasteland when it gets too hot

Special.name: ritrebate
Special.description: All rituals cast on this location will be cheaper.

Special.name: bonusrelics
Special.description: Get this number of extra relics from this location. By default the amount of relics is one less than the amount of sacrifices earned.

Special.name: nosnowpen
Special.description: No income penalty from snow.

Special.name: farvis
Special.description: Can be seen from far away.

Special.name: seepast
Special.description: Far horizon (like sea).

Special.name: port
Special.description: Ships can enter this terrain.

Special.name: realport
Special.description: Ships can be recruited here.

Special.name: misty
Special.description: Mist emanates from here.

Special.name: anchored
Special.description: Dimensionally anchored location.

Special.name: hardfly
Special.description: Difficult to fly here costs 2 AP.

Special.name: nevercold
Special.description: This square will never get cold.

Special.name: ug
Special.description: This is an underground terrain.

Special.name: town1
Special.description: One town point.

Special.name: town2
Special.description: Two town points.

Special.name: cityname
Special.description: This terrain should start with a random city name.

Start.name: selectterr
Start.description: Select the terrain to be modified. Select a low number to alter an existing terrain or select a number between 500 - 999 to create a new terrain.
